faqs.question: Why am I too tired to workout when I'm getting enough sleep?
faqs.answer: Paradox: Low energy is often CAUSED by no exercise, not fixed by rest. Sedentary lifestyle = mitochondria (cellular energy) atrophy. Exercise stimulates mitochondrial growth = more energy production. You don't need more rest—you need progressive movement to rebuild energy-producing capacity. Rest alone can't fix this.
